definition: leeway/latitude/room for freedom of action
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]
to revolve/a loop/a circle
to whirl/immediately/variant of 鏇|镟[xuan4]
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
(archaic) I/me/variant of 餘|余[yu2], surplus
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: That will severely limit Obama's room for manoeuvre at the Copenhagen talks.
sentences.chinese: 这将严重限制了奥巴马在哥本哈根谈判中的回旋余地。

sentences.english: This bipartisanship may give him leeway to set a new course.
sentences.chinese: 两党合作可能让他获得制定新方向的回旋余地。

sentences.english: Otherwise, the room to maneuver macroeconomic policy will only get smaller.
sentences.chinese: 否则，宏观经济政策的回旋余地只会变得越来越小。

sentences.english: Individual American politicians have great latitude to propose new laws.
sentences.chinese: 个别美国政客在提出新法时有着很大的回旋余地。

sentences.english: This influx of money could be exaggerating the market's gyrations.
sentences.chinese: 大量资金的流入会夸大市场的回旋余地。

sentences.english: Work quite bouncy , stay have room for manoeuvre.
sentences.chinese: 做事颇有弹性，留有回旋余地。

definition: to have room to save a situation/margin for error (idiom)
margin/leeway
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
to leave some leeway/to allow for the unpredictable
to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
odds of success/stratagem that ensures success/to be sure of success
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to leave room to maneuver/to leave a margin for error
(lit.) to hold sb by the elbow/(fig.) to hold back/to impede/to handicap
to make a decision when it's time to decide
to leave oneself a way out
through road/way out/way to survive/means of subsistence
labor/physical work
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to make a decision/resolution/decisiveness/resolute
escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
